Reviews.Title: Good TV, great gaming monitor
Reviews.Author: Six
Reviews.Content: I saw this tv at my local Brandsmart and was impressed; it had perhaps the best picture among standard LED tvs. An LG rep said the LB5800 series use an IPS panel with full array LED backlighting. With help from another Amazon member, we were able to determine the 39" uses an MVA panel, while the 32" uses an IPS panel (see comments). On LG's claim of full array LED backlighting, I assume it's valid, perhaps without local dimming as found on the LB6300 series.I wanted a large screen gaming monitor to sit on my desk. This tv is pretty much all screen so no wasted space. Legs are sturdy, metal with plastic finish. Powered off, the screen is dark and not quite glossy but not quite matte. Colors are bright and vibrant, blacks are deep, screen is bright and uniform.As a monitor, the 60hz panel works because input via HDMI from seems limited to 60hz anyway, meaning I could not overclock the 60hz refresh rate using several methods. I suggest not getting hung up on advertised refresh rates though, screen is fast and blurring is minimal even during gaming. TV does have a gaming mode which turns off video processing. While I can't assign a value to input lag, I can say this tv feels more responsive than my old Samsung with no gaming mode. Desktop text is fairly sharp, but doesn't compare to an IPS 1900x1200 monitor.I find these settings optimal for monitor/gaming:backlight = 80contrast = 80brightness = 50color = 50sharpness = 10picture mode = gameenergy saving = offOn general TV functions, menus are easy to navigate, Netflix streaming tuned in at HD with no buffering. Sound is okay, it's bottom firing, with some voice clarity lost behind the screen. Sound bar recommended for best experience. 120 motion index makes movement, especially people moving across screen seem somewhat animated, looks good though.Lastly, LG uses sturdy Styrofoam packing and box material. Box is study, corners hold fast, box center doesn't yield much even with decent pressure applied. Easy assembly and menu config, up and running in under ten minutes.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: Calvin G
Reviews.Content: I started out just looking for a tv for my home office. Nothing special, just wanted it to have some basic smart features. I started out a VIZIO 32" E320I-A0 and was far from satisfied.  Outside of the quality reminding me of some sort of cheap knock off electronic, the interface was slow and horrible. Luckily I came to my senses and decided to spend a little more for this model. The LB5800 is a solid smart LED TV. It looks great, A/V performance is excellent, and feels like it was worth the money. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a under 40in TV.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture, Great Features
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I love this TV! This has a great, clear picture. The other features such as Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, and YouTube just add even more bonus to the purchase. I love how I can control YouTube from my phone and send the YouTube video from my phone directly to the TV (via the YouTube app on my phone and on the TV). This makes searching for videos much easier than trying to type with the TV remote.

Reviews.Title: Just as nice as my 42" LG Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Robert "Old World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: There is ONE big problem that I ran into.  I ordered the Magic Remote AN-MR400.  This TV is a 2014 TV.  Prior to ordering the Magic Remote I asked a lot of questions and went to the LG website.  I never saw that one must get an MR500 to work with this TV because the MR400 does not.  The MR400 turns the TV on, but there is NO cursor, making the remote useless.  Amazon does not have the MR500 so I have to go to LG for that.  I learned all of this through a long chat with LG.  There is always something that costs you more time and more money.  I should have known better because LG never responded to my questions about the remote, as in "Does the MR400 work with this TV?"The MR400 is awesome on my LG 2013 42" Smart TV.It would be nice if there were more information on such things.  LG and Samsung have so many products even they can't keep up with their own changes.

Reviews.Title: THIS IS AWESOME!!! DEFINITELY A GREAT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Guaier Huang
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I only pay less than 500 to get this awesome TV. It has everything you need, netflix, youtube, hulu and amazon, etc. The quality of image is superb and the sound is also amazing. And 42 inch is wayy enough for my apartment. If you want a HD smart TV, then I think this is the one!

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Shawn B.
Reviews.Content: Tv colors 10 out 10 black levels 9 out 10 sound 8 half out 10 alot of control settings  10 out 10 over all design 10 out 10 remote control 8 out 10 smart tv functions 8 out of 10

Reviews.Title: Didn't meet expectations
Reviews.Author: Aggiefan "Aggiefan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 2014 model TV because of the Smart TV features. Unfortunately, several of the apps I had planned to use (Dish Network Virtual Joey, Pandora, etc.) are not compatible with this model. Very disappointing that LG would have a current year item that does not play all its 2014 LG Smart World apps. LG's web site also does not provide this information until you have the TV and register for Smart World. In addition, the on-screen registration is tedious and difficult to enter required information. One fat finger slip and it's start all over again and again.

Reviews.Title: Good Budget TV
Reviews.Author: Vino B. Kannapiran "Vino"
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality and adequate picture setting controls and inputs. Fixed stand may not work for some.Ideal for small rooms

Reviews.Title: Really good TV for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: Greta
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in some reviews, the sound is not great without being augmented by an audio system of some kind.  I'm using the TV without any additional audio system and with some setting changes have it working fine for what I need.  I watch regular TV and movies (cable and streaming through Amazon Prime and Netflix).  Fairly easy to set up and no issues to speak of at this point.  I think I'll be very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: K.H.
Reviews.Content: We don't do any gaming so I can't write a review in regards to that. I am amazed at how far technology has come, I love the smart features. We had originally been hooking up our computer to the tv to watch netflix and amazon prime. Now we just stream it off of the tv apps. I love the quality of the picture and the tv is very light so a small person like myself can pick it up with ease. This is a great tv and I recommend it especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: rich
Reviews.Content: Good TV shows good great buy for the price.. I am going to but another for the bedroom a 47" get 1 you'll like it....

Reviews.Title: Happy with the product
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: TV is very good and had a good price for this too . my just disappointment is with volume , it does not give enough volume with my optimum cable box.

Reviews.Title: This LED ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: Jason P Sylvia
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best bang for your buck. The picture quality is stunning. Crisp and vibrant colors as well as sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Native NYer "NYer"
Reviews.Content: Coming from a TV that was more than 15 years old it was a pleasure to receive the LG Smart TV.  Yes, I went to a store and looked at sets before I ordered. I was  a little overwhelmed with the settings, but once I got the hang of it everything worked well!  The picture quality is great, the color is great, I am very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love my LG TV
Reviews.Author: Star Trek Fan
Reviews.Content: LG has awesome clarity and the two stand feature is steady and  can be moved easily. The smart TV makes selection so much easier, too.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for the kitchen
Reviews.Author: Tanksgiving
Reviews.Content: Remodeling my kitchen and I needed a slim TV to fit in a recessed wall. The LG 39" was perfect and its extremely easy to set up. Its connected to my WIFI, internet apps work great and the low glare in a bright kitchen is perfect. For $400, can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Ordered 2, Both Arrived Damaged
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I love the features on this product, but when it arrived and was plugged in, white pixellated lines were showing across the top and left hand sides of the screen, no matter what channel.  Customer support thought the screen might have been damaged in shipping, so I ordered a replacement.  The replacement was much worse.  Though the unit appeared fine, when it was plugged in the screen looked all cracked with wild colors -- like it had been hit with a hammer.  Both the original and replacement were shipped in OEM box, with no outer box protection.  I don't know if this is a manufacturing issue or a packaging issue, but LG needs to fix this problem.  In the end, I ended up ordering a different manufacturer's monitor.  On the plus side, Amazon handled the returns with no questions asked, and free one day shipping for the replacement.  Yay Amazon Prime!!

Reviews.Title: Our first flat is a WINNER!
Reviews.Author: R. Levine
Reviews.Content: This LG 42: flat screen is our first and we LOVE it!! Sometimes it feels like you're actually IN the movie.And, setup was a SNAP!!!I wish the stand would have been in the middle instead of on each end of the set but, we made do.Will probably buy an LG 60" when our Mits 46" Projection takes its final dump.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: rinch
Reviews.Content: TV is great. we're still trying to make it SMART so we can watch internet on it. I'm sure it's us not TV

Reviews.Content: this item is so good...but there is a small problem .tv socket is different with our thing...so we needed a divert-gender(?) for socket...there is no problem except this..

Reviews.Title: Nice screen/design, low refresh rate, not really that smart.
Reviews.Author: Timothy Guillermo
Reviews.Content: I've never bought a TV in my life. So I first bought a TCL 30" 1080 HD television. However little did I know, words and stats do not mean anything. Apparently HD can be anything from pixelated images to blurry movements. I bought that TV for $289, obviously got what I paid for. So I returned the TV and decided to go with something a little high-end. So as I asked around, the Frys, salesman was really persistent on selling me this particular TV. I thought he was just trying to get commission or something. I asked about refresh rate and how it would affect the TV. He said something like it really doesn't matter, something along those lines. He didn't tell me that low refresh rate would mean laggy picture and blurry fast movements. Hence the fact that 60hz is not well suited for action movies. I hooked up my macbook pro and mirrored my display on the TV and that's when I knew it was the last straw. It may be a small tiny detail but that detail annoyed the **** out of me. The mouse pointer on the TV was lagging behind maybe 1 second or less. I mean I paid $599 for this thing! Why is it laggy, and why are the fast movements blurry!!!I wouldnt recommend this to someone who watches a lot of action movies or if you like to connect your computer and actually know your mouse pointer is moving the exact way you are in real time.However if you want a SMART TV and looking for a large screen with a good size for the price and definition then this may be it for you. Just know any fast pace movies will be affected by the low refresh rates.Overall average tv for the average consumer.
